website_summaries.verdict: Tired of wrestling with single-piece shades that never fit quite right? This set of two shades gives you flexibility without all the hassle.
pros: Set of two identical rectangular shades
Versatile – install vertically or horizontally for perfect fit
Easy install and store when done
Keeps out 99% of the sun's rays
Looks good because it fits well instead of bunching up
cons: Rearview mirror can interfere with complete coverage

customer_reviews.title: RUINED dashboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shade on August 10 and it arrived on August 12, 2017. I immediately started using it. I noticed it was sticking to the dashboard, but overall the car seemed cooler and, I did not think it was a big deal. This morning, however, when I removed the sunshade, it took a big chuck out of my dashboard. The sunshade was in use probably from 12:30-1:00 pm yesterday until about 7:00 am today. I am really upset and am not sure where to proceed from here, but I do think future buyers should be aware of this possibility.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Holland

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Fit & Scratched Dash
customer_reviews.text: Not only did this not fit (even when using their sizing chart), but it put a huge scratch on my dash. I bought a new vehicle and purchased this to help protect the dash and now my 2 week old vehicle has a huge scratch across it because of the wires in this poorly made product. Very, very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It worked well until it broke, not one week later
customer_reviews.text: It works very well. However, mine fell apart on day #5. Specifically, the stiches holding the frame on one side burst, making it almost impossible to fold up, and very bad at blocking the sun since there was now a gaping hole that was sure to get worse on one side. I suppose I could use half of it, but what's the point?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2013 Honda CR-V, the 2 pieces give almost complete coverage see pic. They stay put without the visors holding them in place but I use the visors just to be safe. I was specifically looking for this type, they fold into a circle with very little effort once you learn how that works and stores easily.
customer_reviews.author: Linda in Dixie

customer_reviews.title: it's not what they advertised
customer_reviews.text: According to the write up, it is supposed to fit my car perfectly. It doesn't. I bought this one to replace a product that didn't fit well. This is not any better. As for keeping the car cooler I'll have to use it a couple of times during our hot days to find out. So far after receiving it today, I'm not all that impressed. It is tough to fold back up, I know it is new, but didn't know I would have to get into a wrestling match every time I want to put the thing away. If I find it doesn't keep the car cooler it will have to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: C. White

customer_reviews.title: The website description was inaccurate. They tell you to ...
customer_reviews.text: The website description was inaccurate. They tell you to follow the chart. Find your vehicle type and then you will know what size you need. I have a 2013 Jetta. The medium sized shades I ordered did not fit. They were HUGE and could barely fit in the windshield. Not to mention if you have a mirror that is mounted on the glass, these shades do not work. I had to return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Potts

customer_reviews.title: Useless after 3 uses. Frame warped very early on.
customer_reviews.text: I only had the chance to use it about three times before the frame warped and it became essentially unusable. Not only does it not fold into the little circle it's supposed to fold into, but it's too warped to prop up in my windshield. I wish I would have used it more immediately, because by the time I discovered this deficiency, it was too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: WNH

customer_reviews.title: They scratched my dash
customer_reviews.text: Theses shades are large and cumbersome to use. They scratched the dash of my brand new car. Once I figured out how to use them without hitting the dash, they did work, but not any better or worse than any other sun shade I've had. It would be much better if the edges had some cushion to prevent scratches. If anyone knows of a way to get scratches out of a dashboard, let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Marly

customer_reviews.title: Within a few days destroyed my tinted windows (heats up interior, not reflective enough)
customer_reviews.text: This product does the opposite of what is expected. The material is not reflective enough and therefore it captures heat and heats the interior. It destroy my factory tinted windows by causing them to peel from the heat in just a few days of use. HUGE REGRETS and very expensive to replace. I made a big mistake purchasing this product, wish I could go back.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: First off these do not cover your whole windshield, therea always a gap no matter how you put them. Also, I noticed a tear on one of the corners out of nowhere so theres that
customer_reviews.author: berner

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. For something that needs to be bent for every use, it sure broke easily. It looks like bad design rather than I got unlucky. The metal frame is not held together well at the ends.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Let there be shade!
customer_reviews.text: Less sun in the car = less heat inside. Easy to use and store. Unfolds quick and put it right up against the windshield, you can do it in seconds. Folds away in seconds and it comes with a pouch. Doesnt take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: Herman L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this one if you don't know which sunshade to get!! Does what it's supposed to do. I estimate it cools my car down between 20-25 degrees fahrenheit and I don't even have to put my sun visor down to keep it in place. And the dishmat is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A.

customer_reviews.title: Please read before purchase
customer_reviews.text: These are two separate shades. They do not reach long enough to keep the sun out, nor do they stay in place, simply fall. Instructions say use your visors to keep in place. Visors don’t bend that far. Super disappointed. Waste of money :(
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Better Options Available Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I got this one for myself and the Kinder Fluff product for my husband to compare the two. They pretty much look like they're made by the same manufacturer at first glance, but his seems more substantial and better made. His folds more easily because the plastic edge better as the plastic edging is smaller/flimsier in mine. The stitching is poorly done on this one - it doesn't line up and it looks like it's not going to last any time at all after a few bakes in the sun. The other product was less expensive, too...would recommend that one, instead.
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I drive a 2002 sedan. Depending on how you place the shades, you either have sun coming through the top or the sides. Width and height need to be adjusted. However, I can deal with a little sun peaking through if the shades actually stayed up. But because the width or height is a bit off, no matter how I place it, it will fall down. The visors try to hold it back enough but it just ends up tilting. It's like playing jigsaw jenga every day. You're not sure if this position will just make it fall down. Get something else. They charge you for return shipping when you realize it barely fits so not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Suze

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this product 😊
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large for my vehicle but it was a little to big but it still fits. Although I have illegal tint on my windows it’s still doesn’t keep the heat out. I installed these shades in my windshield and it really does block the heat from the sunlight. I’m pleased with these visors . I sometimes sit in my car on my hour lunch break and take a nap and I don’t have to have my ac on full blast while I’m in the car because these visors blocks the heat so my ac fan is on low.
customer_reviews.author: PinCkButterfly

customer_reviews.title: Worn-Out Accordion Sunshade?
customer_reviews.text: This is a spring-tension border design, so it will hold its' shape a lot longer than the foil-over-cardboard accordion-styled ones that usually don't fit very well. Be sure to reference the size guide charts prior to ordering this item! Mine fit great and provided excellent coverage without a struggle to put up or take down. Also, very easy to fold into circle and tuck away, or simply stack and tuck behind the seat. Super easy! So much easier to use and store than the old, pleated, foil on backerboard monstrosity I had, which didn't hold up very well at all.
customer_reviews.author: CGreen03

customer_reviews.title: Fits My Acura Integra Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I just moved to Tucson, AZ. The sun is so powerful that you cannot comfortably handle the steering wheel after the car a/c has been off for a few minutes. The EzyShade sunshade makes a world of difference in how hot my car interior gets, especially the steering wheel and seats (honestly, they can get hot enough burn you right through your clothes). Having two pieces means I can overlap them and adjust their orientation so that the entire windshield is blocked. It works great! Putting the sunshades up and taking them down is literally the work of a few seconds. And the payoff is a car that cools down in a minute or two instead of 10 or 15.
customer_reviews.author: kiltguy

customer_reviews.title: Happy with these EzyShades
customer_reviews.text: The size chart recommended a size "small" for my Jeep, but I didn't see that size available here on Amazon, so I bought a medium. I was able to make it work by scrunching each panel underneath the sun visor and then folding the visor down to hold it in place. The shades seem to work fine. Easy to fold or just toss in the back if you will be using them again. Not sure about durability since I have had them only a few days. My son tried his in a Nissan Pathfinder. Medium size was a good fit but his rear view mirror sticks out pretty far and keeps the shade from being flat.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: Size chart is not accurate...
customer_reviews.text: According to the size chart I needed an XL (2018 Chevy Cruze hatchback). It arrived and was very easy to take apart, instructions came as well if you need extra help. They are rectangular shape, so I placed them horizontally in my windshield but there are several gaps along the sides and a huge opening where the rear view mirror is located. I tried turning it vertical but they are too large to go that way. I will definitely be looking for other options but decided to keep these because it’s better than nothing. If you are interested in sun visors I would recommend going with another option, maybe the traditional long foldable ones are a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Thomas AG

customer_reviews.title: Love this Sun Protector
customer_reviews.text: I drive a Kia Soul and live in super sunny South Florida with no covered parking, so you can imagine how hot my dashboard and steering can get. This shade protector comes as two (2) separate shields that lay beautifully across my dash. I use my visors to hold them in place. No fiddling around trying to get them situated properly -- they lay in place perfectly. Once you take them away, you place one on top of the other, grab both ends, twist once and they fold back into a circle with a safety strap. You can't beat the price for such a great protector. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BeachCat

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend for Tesla Model 3.
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly made for the model 3 Tesla, but it covers well enough and I love that I can easily fold them down and stash them out of the way. If you’re looking for complete coverage for this vehicle, you may be disappointed. There’s maybe a crack or two on the edges that are left uncovered. However, I loved them over the accordion or roll-up kind cause I feel those would be too large and cumbersome for me to be dealing with all the time. I’m in California so these sunshades will be getting opened and closed a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Marita4blue

customer_reviews.title: too much work
customer_reviews.text: So these don't have any way of holding themselves up. (The seller recommends using visor.) It comes with a neat bag to store -if you can ever figure out how to fit them in it! Instead, i've had to just toss them in the back seat which makes it uncomfortable for any passengers (and i look like a messy person). My biggest disappointment though is that the material somehow stained with disinfectant cleaner. As far as keeping the heat out... i didn't notice enough of an improvement to deal with the hassle
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, stays in place
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sun shade to replace a dollar store one that didn't cover the full area and wouldn't keep it's shape. I have a Hyundai Elantra and these two pieces cover perfectly when stood lengthwise on each half of the windshield with enough overlap to only leave a tiny spot uncovered at the very bottom of the middle. They are easy to put in place behind the mirror and cover the entire windshield from top to bottom and side to side. They don't even need the visors to stay in place. The spring wire frame holds their shape nicely. Great product. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Chedeseter

customer_reviews.title: Nice.  Works
customer_reviews.text: There's not much to say other than they do what they say. With my largish SUV I got the medium and put them in long-way vertical, which fits well. They list the dimensions for the sizes so measure windshield and decide which size and orientation will work best. I only gave them 4 stars as the fabric is not as substantial and reflective as my previous sun shade. I don't think this consequentially affects them doing their job. Time will tell how the hold up.
customer_reviews.author: mssurface4

customer_reviews.title: Quality sun shades at great price
customer_reviews.text: The sun shades arrived quickly and were as described. The large size is great. I had to return a set I bought from another vendor because it did not cover the whole window. The metal frame is stiff enough to keep the shade flat but flexible enough to allow the shade to be closed easily. The fabric also feels more sturdy than another set of collapsible sun shades that I have. They come with a handy bag to hold the shades when not in use. I have not tried the dashboard anti-slip pad bonus gift so don't have any comments on that.
customer_reviews.author: K Ho

customer_reviews.title: Not so sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t fit “snug” because of my rear view mirror.. wasn’t always the easiest to fold up it’s big and inside the car space it’s a little difficult to maneuver. I decided to keep it and then today when I folded it the metal frame broke and busted through. This is the second style like this I’ve bought in the last 3 weeks, although this one fit better than the last it seems I’ve waisted more money again. Probably back to the old accordion style for me, wanted to try something different but oh well
customer_reviews.author: QueenOfHisReign

customer_reviews.title: Busted seam after barely a month
customer_reviews.text: This is not a very durable product. After just a couple of weeks of folding and unfolding, the shades have come undone at the seam. If you're like me, and take them down when you drive ;) they're going to go through a lot of folding and unfolding so I feel they should have better stitching to last longer than a month. I'm not sure how much longer these will last before the tear at the seam gets big enough to make them useless and I'll have to get another set. I hate having to replace something after just a couple of months! And the return policy is void after, yup, you guessed it....one month. Grr!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Not Ideal.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because the description implied it would work perfectly for an Audi A4. It doesn’t, however. The two pieces of shading are just big squares and don’t account for the large, fixed mirror my car has. I am able to rig them up to work well enough, but I don’t love them. Folding them is incredibly difficult, like extremely difficult. I had to watch the instructional video multiple times to get it somewhat right and it barely fits back in the carrying bag. I suppose for the price, what should I expect?
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the sun out of the vehicle pretty well
customer_reviews.text: The sun shield works fairly well to keep the sun out of my 2017 Chevy Traverse. I can move the 2 pieces around to get most of the windshield covered. I found that it has better windshield coverage if I put it over the rear view mirror rather than under it. I have to fold down the sun visors to keep in place, but then, I had to with my old one as well. I'm still struggling with the fold up twist of the wrist movement to stow it. I can get it closed up to a manageable size now after I have tried it 5-6 times.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after buying a new car that did not have tinted windows. They are super easy to use and pop right up to the correct size. I think I may have ordered the wrong size for my window as they're quite wide and do over lap but they fit nicely from top to bottom. I think the bag they come in could be slightly bigger for rebagging, however I have decided to just tuck them into the space between the passenger seat and the center console. I would definitely buy them again and recommend them to anyone looking for a sun visor - they are much more efficient than the fold up map type.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy J

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money Or You Will Get Scorched
customer_reviews.text: There is no way this two piece sunshield lays flat with rearview mirrors that hang from the windshield. I turned it in all directions, but there were always gaps where the rearview mirror was. When I got back to the car after it had been in the sun for hours, the car was a little cooler but the steering wheel was pretty hot. I tried folding the two pieces per the instructions, but gave up and tossed them in the back. Save your money. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty NaylerTop Contributor: Poker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sunshade - simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I personally love these shades. I replaced a set from another company I had been using for 15 years or more with these. They use the same reverse twist to close as the old one (although being newer the spring is a little springier). Don't complain about them being hard to close if you haven' t read and followed the instructions. And if you don't understand - look at a youtube video. It's simple once you know how. These are sturdy, well-made, and sized perfectly. I measured first to make sure I got the right size for my Hyundai Sonata.
customer_reviews.author: dragondancer

customer_reviews.title: Awkward but Utilitarian
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought it would be sizable to my windshield. It is not and the website doesn't provide info re: which auto models it actually fits properly. However, utilizing the sun visors of my car to secure the panels to the windshield, I was able to position them in a manner that works. While I prefer a sunshade that suctions to the window, I do like that this doesn't require suction cups that are easily lost. All in all, it's useful and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: paulinedove

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: This came today. I am reserving judgement for now. What I can say is that it is designed for a car that doesn’t have the rear view mirror attached to the the windshield. I don’t know how it will hold up when having to deform it slightly to fit around the mirror. I bought the size recommended for my car. 5/27 -I have found a way to use the shades without crunching them. I position them in front of the mirror and use the visors to hold them in place. Should have thought or that first. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: K. Young

customer_reviews.title: SLIGHT size issue with 2012 F150, but overall OK
customer_reviews.text: This product is what I wanted/expected. The shipping was fast and accurate. My only gripe is the F150 sizing chart. It called for a medium and I ordered it. The ezshade cover most of my windshield, but there are gaps. I have tried laying the shades with the long side vertically and horizontally. There is always a couple inches of gap. Overall it will work fine, but for someone who absolutely wants complete protection for your dash, you may need to go a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: It's compact...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2016 Jeep Patriot, was a little skeptical about the suggested size for my SUV. But once installed it does offer about 99% coverage and heat blocking seems to be adequate. I really like the compactness... but it does take a little practice getting used to folding it for storage. Overall I am satisfied with my purchase... the bonus stay put mat is pretty strong and I tried sticking it to my bedroom dresser mirror to attach a 7" tablet it held it for about 10 minutes and then it fell... probably more suitable for a cell phone or something just a tad bit lighter., either way, it works.
customer_reviews.author: AS_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Fits Honda Civic 2009 the Best!
customer_reviews.text: The past two windshield shades I got on Amazon didn't fit my 2009 Honda Civic. Until I found this! It fits like a glove, it's lightweight, and ultimately stays put! It comes with a cover and a sticky dashboard pad. It's inexpensive and easy to slip in between the seat and middle console. Beware of tangling the structure material. It tends to happen with twistable shades. Be gentle when closing. Do not try to bend or snap the wire/plastic inside the seam.
customer_reviews.author: LCL

customer_reviews.title: Fit is very good (08 Sonata- medium), easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: The tension spring is hefty and provides good hold with no droop or need for sunvisors. Folds easily but tight fit back in the storage bag (which I don't use anyway). Each shade has a stretch cord which is convenient for removal. The shades are rectangular and fit with the long way up and down instead of left to right like most shades I've had. Completely fills the windshield that way and the rear view mirror is not an issue. Probably the best I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can finally touch my steering wheel when my car has been sitting in the hot sun!
customer_reviews.text: Finally! I can leave work after my car is sitting in the sun all day and not burn my fingers in my steering wheel. I’m amazed at what a difference it makes on the temperature inside the car. There is a learning curve on folding them back up if you want to put them back in the handy case. It took me a few minutes to figure it out but that just is probably me. Plus I usually just leave them in the back seat while I’m driving anyway. But the case is nice if you have a car full of people or if you’re a neat freak.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Eisnaugle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product does exactly as they described
customer_reviews.text: I checked a ton of reviews for window shades on Amazon and EzyShade had the best reviews for products that fit my truck in the price range I was looking for. I was not disappointed in the shade I purchased. It blocks the sun as expected, the material feels thicker than my previous window shade, and is super easy to fold and stores nicely between my seat and center console. It also came with a dash sticky pad for your phone or anything you want to stay put as you drive.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin in Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Best window sun shades out there
customer_reviews.text: I researched and found the perfect automotive sun shades (My opinion) on the market. There is no mounting or suction cups to deal with, these thing actually just pop into place. You need to push a little bit on them to get them into the edge of the window and frame, but once they are there they look great. They actually work like window tint for the fact that you can't see into my car when they are in. I have black leather upholstery and they keep the seat cooler than normal. I highly recommend trying these. I own two sets, one for each of my cars.
customer_reviews.author: Maria L Mangione

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Used
customer_reviews.text: We've used the folding cardboard type shade with shiny foil for years. We often noticed the whole shade got extremely hot (even on the inside) and thought that likely added to car interior temperature rise. We got these oblong shades and they are far superior. Much thinner than the cardboard folding type, but block sun and STAY cool. So, we love them for performance helping keep our car interior cooler. I gave only 4 stars because my wife struggles with folding them up. Her old and arthritic hands & fingers are the likely cause.
customer_reviews.author: Kars-A-Plenty

customer_reviews.title: Sun Be Gone!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit apprehensive about the fit for my Lexus LS 400, even though most reviews were positive. The product does what is claims though. The size of the two separate shades conforms to many size windshields. Even if the fit isn't quite right, you can use your sun visors for additional support - and, it folds up nicely when removed from the windshield. I wish I had started using something like this years ago. Good seller, good price, good product. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Cooler Car Interior
customer_reviews.text: After burning my hands on my steering wheel and shifter, I bought these AND THEY WORK! One of my friends was surprised at the difference in the car’s temperature noting it wasn’t as hot as she expected it to be when it was 100* outside. They are a bit stubborn to fold at times but that’s not an issue for me. I am unaware of any suctioning power. My car’s windshield has an instrument panel on it so having 2 separate pieces is a plus. Nothing would fit flat under it and these are easy to wiggle in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Flexibility of use
customer_reviews.text: I like the two-piece design, makes it much easier to put in place. It also gives the flexibility to fit in different vehicles. Folding is still a bit tricky and sometimes requires more than one attempt. As for protection- on first use i left the e-pass (for tollway) on the windshield, the returned heat melted the glue of the sticky pads. That e-pass was there for several years, same weather, so i all that heat that got reflected is the one that now stays out of the car. If you have one on the windshield, you might want to remove or place those without covering it
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shahaf

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Cools, but there needs to be more quality control
customer_reviews.text: The first pair received I had to return as the corner seams were coming apart. Ordered a replacement to give it another shot and so far it’s been about 2 1/2 weeks and they’ve been great during these hot summer months. They definitely provide shade to the front of the car and at least that keeps your seats/seatbelts and steering wheel from getting hot! I ordered a Medium for Honda Insight and it works fine. For a small biz on amazon they have great customer service, just some advice for them is to make sure the quality control of products also stays strong!
customer_reviews.author: Doris

customer_reviews.title: Just what I've been looking for to replace accordion shades
customer_reviews.text: This 2-piece windshield shade fits perfectly in my Honda CRV and kept the vehicle cooler. Easy to place and folds up easily into a neat bundle for storing in the pouch it came with. It took a few tries to get the hang of folding them up but will eventually be a breeze to do with constant use. I highly recommend this product; I'll be buying another set for my husband's car.
customer_reviews.author: Vanina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use sun shades
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sun shades for a 2016 Nissan Altima SV and they work very well keeping the car cooler. They are also extremely easy to fold and put in the bag, compared to other similar products I have tried in the past especially with the attached elastic strap. These are universal though and as such the fit isn't perfect. I do have a small gap which sunlight can get in due to the size of the rear view mirror (I am using the Medium size). The small would have been much too small for this car and I am ultimately happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Great transaction with a friendly company. Makes me want to use him when I need something.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these shades sets. One for my wife's car and one for mine. Very happy with how they install. Much easier than the accordion style. Price is good as well as ease of use. Good product. The best part of my purchase was when I sent a message and how fast he answered it. I appreciate not being ignored because he already has the money. His response was fast and very friendly. I will have no issues doing business with him in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Marc D. Kreate

customer_reviews.title: Guess it better then nothing.
customer_reviews.text: Live in FL. They show these things on cars that don't have rear view mirrors. Would probably work better if that was for real, but the fit is not that tight, and every little bit lets in heat. I also have a camera that these things knock around. and I need to take them out before the passenger gets in. Will be better to build a sunscreen outside of the car, but if you have no choice, these will work.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Nice...but only for a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Even though it was hard to figure out how to fold these shades, I was impressed with how they worked....at least at first. I have only been using them a couple of weeks now and the seams are already coming apart and the band has broken off one of them. It's not even worth the hassle to try to return them. I guess I'll just switch to buying my shades at Wal-Mart.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for blocking sun but a hassle to use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product but unfortunately I don’t. I do really really like it though. It provides good protection from the sun however I’m not sure how much it really helped with lowering the inside temp. My big pick really is that they were such a pain to set in the windshield! Trying to place these just right was always a hassle for me and my husband! I returned mine and found something that works great!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, plus the sticky pad
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sun shade protector that would fold up tightly into a small circle. This one does this, but it in two pieces. You set the pieces on top of each other and then twist diagonally into the small circle. I've never gotten it back into the sleeve it comes in for two reasons: 1) it would take quite a while to make it fit again and 2) I'm just using it the next day anyway, so I store mine in the passenger's back seat pocket. Its just a grab and go item then for me. The sticky pad works pretty good--I keep my work ID on it but even my sunglasses will stay.
customer_reviews.author: PAL

customer_reviews.title: great but get the right size!
customer_reviews.text: I had a feeling that I was buying the wrong size and of course they are smaller than I would like. Still, they work well because they have elastic bands that I can hook on my visors. I should have exchanged for a larger size but I honestly didn't want to go without them because even though smaller than I wanted, they provide excellent sun & heat protection. I got a medium for my little ford escape. The new cars these days are all windshield so I maybe could get by with the XL but for sure needed at least a large. Durable unlike the foil ones.
customer_reviews.author: SHEILA R TWITE

customer_reviews.title: Sizing guide was wrong
customer_reviews.text: I went according to the size recommended on the list they had here based on my car brand and model so I was expecting it to fit. I had to return it as it was too small for my Honda Accord... things that I liked about it was that it came with a little sleeve that you can fit it in when not in use. The little gift that came with it came damaged.
customer_reviews.author: S. Philip

customer_reviews.title: ... reviews and looking at sizes this one seemed the best. I just used it for the first time ...
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a 2017 Honda CRV and wanted a Sunshade and after reading reviews and looking at sizes this one seemed the best. I just used it for the first time today and it helped keep the car cooler. The two pieces covered the windshield completely. I didn't have any trouble folding it back up and the fact that it comes with it's own storage bag is great. It fits perfectly in the pocket on the back of the passage seat. Glad I picked this one
customer_reviews.author: Pamela. G.

customer_reviews.title: Much cooler in this AR heat
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using the EzyShade windshield sun shade (medium) for a week now. It’s worked great so far, though I do have trouble with it sticking in the crevice of the windshield from time to time making it difficult to remove without tearing. I do use the visors to hold them in place as the rear view mirror is in the way preventing them from staying on their own. Overall a great product that does exactly what it’s supposed to!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect for my 2019 Highlander.
customer_reviews.text: The medium size fits my 2019 Toyota Highlander like a glove without having to put the sun visors down to hold them in place. I tried them in my 2007 Toyota Tundra and they could work. They just don't reach all the way to the top edge. I will try the recommended large size for that one. However I might get another set of medium shades to cover the side windows in the front for longer parking times.
customer_reviews.author: The Websters

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that these visors collapse when folded. This makes it easier to store away. However I was DISSAPOINTED that the “size chart” is not much for my vehicle type cause it did not fit my vehicle's windshield AS SHOWN in the picture (take note folks). My car (Honda Accord) has a windshield with a sensor assembly. It will only fit like the picture if I place it in my rear windshield (unless your country doesn’t require your vehicle to have something as important as a rear view mirror!).
customer_reviews.author: wlthlla

customer_reviews.title: Weirdly covers front window
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty easy to fold you just have to get used to folding it. Really helpful for summer time it definitely reduces the heat inside the car when you put it on. It has this weird shape when it covers the front. It's like having a weird bump when you're a lady wearing some pants/jeans. That's how it looks like with the mirror you have on the front of the car. Works pretty well tho!
customer_reviews.author: PleasantCookIeMonster

customer_reviews.title: Sticks to Dashboard
customer_reviews.text: Just like what another reviewer wrote, it started sticking to the area of the dash where the dash & windshield meet. Some kind of glue in the black edging that seeps out in the hot sun. And let me say that it wasn't a minor sticking but an almost glue on feel. I had to give a good tug to remove from the dash. The other reviewer said it ruined the dash, I'm not waiting for that to happen, returned promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: These are not very good as far as sizing goes. I used the chart but these are too small and don't stay up. They are too small to be held up by the visors or in any other way. Some times I can wedge them so that they kind of work but usually they end up falling down. They are easily bent out of shape then they are unable to be folded correctly so you have to unfold them and pop them back into form and start over. This process can take several tries and ain't nobody got time for that!
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: BEST CAR SUNSHADE I'VE EVER PURCHASED
customer_reviews.text: I've used this now for 4 months and still LOVE IT. Best sunshade I’ve ever owned. I like that it’s 2 pieces which you can easily just hook it on your individual mirror on your passenger and driver seat. It doesn't get hot and fall off like those shiny silver 1-piece accordian things. Totally reflects the sun and keeps the car cool. It folds up really small and has its own little container which takes us no space at all. You can store it under your seat that's how small it gets when easily folded. Love this
customer_reviews.author: Marie Cress

customer_reviews.title: Great sunshade for value, a bit tricky to fold
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I have to give this sunscreen five stars for keeping my car cool in the blazing sun, despite the gaps in coverage as seen in photos. The two pieces are a bit tricky to fold, but I watched the video tutorial and it helped. I usually don't fold them to store; I just put the two pieces together and store them upright in my backseat for quick access when I need them again. But the storage pouch is handy. Again, for the value and sun protection, I'd highly recommend this sun shade for your car.
customer_reviews.author: zenhiker

customer_reviews.title: Good sun visor. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the windshield of my Mitsubishi Lancer and am happy with it. Does what it’s supposed to, fits in the windshield well, and blocks the sun. Detailed instruction are sent with the package on how to fold it up as well as a storage bag and sticky cell phone mount for your dash. Also entered to win a free one or discount code and got both along with a free sun shade sent to me. I would order again!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: A complete difference from not using one. Went through a hard bump in life and this allowed me to sleep during the day much more comfortable. I used my sun visor to hold it up for the most part. Able to slide it under the roof material but it wasn't always the most sturdy. If you need to cool/protect the vehicle, you cant go wrong. I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Diego C.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and useful shades
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of shades I’ve bought of this brand and they work exactly as they should. It helps keep my car nicely cooled and also protects my dash. Haven’t had any problems with this brand and they even sent me an email about being selected in a drawing to receive another pair of these shades FREE, like what... that is just awesome! Overall, pretty cool company and some nice shades that are super easy to fold if you just watch the video provided or read the instructions that it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: e

customer_reviews.title: Best Sun Shade in the Desert!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the car cool living in literally one of the hottest places on Earth, western Arizona. I dont have covered parking at work and it can reach 130 plus degrees during the day. These shades keep my car from melting, keep their shape, and actually cover the whole windshield, unlike many shades I've purchased before. They are super easy to fold and fold into a nice compact size that is easy to store. I convince everyone I know at work to buy them! I hope they come out with some fun designs in the future, that would be a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one year (see picture)
customer_reviews.text: Update 8/2019: broke after one year of use The “medium” fits my E550 perfectly. The “medium” fits my X5 really poorly, even though it is sized as per the manufacturers specs. Fitting aside, it is really hard for me to disassemble the shade. I can never get it perfectly small and I usually just end up tossing it in the back seat due to frustration. I have also noticed that it doesn’t keep my car as cool as my classic shade that spans the whole dash (and literally looks like aluminum foil). I was hoping for a classy solution, but it just doesn’t check off many of the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started falling apart after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product but alas, it is cheaply made. The stitching started coming out of both panels after minimal use. Apparently the act of folding the shades cause them to come apart (and we have been trying to be as gentle as possible). The sizing was right for our car on the plus side. I unfortunately thought I had 90 days to return and should have. It has continued to fall apart until it is now garbage. But it has been 6 weeks. Darn it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product, awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: Nice fabric-type shades, not foil, so they should last a long time. Well made with good quality workmanship. Flip closed easily and the slip case makes them a neat package for storing. I bought magnets so I can use the shades on the outside of my van or if it's too breezy, I can use them inside to keep the sun off the dog crates. Great customer service, prompt and pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteShepMom

customer_reviews.title: Wrestling twice as much
customer_reviews.text: I wrestle with these things too much so Im waiting for a tear to appear soon. I thought since theres two (smaller to deal w) they’d be easier to flip & twist around and toss in bag BUT not w a steering wheel in the way. I throw em in trunk bc they make me cray cray! 😜 I shoulda went old school w the accordian design.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieM

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough
customer_reviews.text: I drive a 2016 Ford Explorer and the shade doesnt fit. I tried it different ways and there is always a sliver of light that gets through. It keeps the car from getting too hot which is why I give 3 stars. I have a feeling it will not last long and once it breaks or stops folding properly I will buy something else
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Smith

customer_reviews.title: FL sun more endurable
customer_reviews.text: My family and I are currently stationed in Jacksonville, FL. In case you aren’t familiar with the location, it is approximately 2 miles from the sun in the summer time! To say it gets hot is an understatement. Having a darker colored vehicle with grey interior does not do anyone any favors during this time of year. However, with EzyShade, we don’t have to worry about losing our fingerprints on the steering wheel or suffer the wrath of the sun. The shades are quick, easy to open and close, and stored conveniently in the provided package. Not only that, but it keep the interiors of the vehicles markedly cooler and far less oppressive in the FL summer.
customer_reviews.author: C. G. Coddington

customer_reviews.title: Dropped dash temp by 40 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first when I saw how thin and light the shades are. Using a temp gun, I measured the unprotected dash of the car to be roughly 170 degrees and the top of the steering wheel was 136. I installed the shades and came back the next day around the same time to find a much cooler interior, 130 dash, 120 steering wheel. Folding the shades is pretty easy once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan clayton

customer_reviews.title: Hard to fold and they do not fit well
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews I read, I was really hoping this sun shade would be the ticket. Unfortunately, they are as hard to fold up as any other type like this one. Additionally, they do not fit well in either our Mazda CX-9 or Hyundai Sonata. The problem is where they come together where the rearview mirror is. Its as if they were constructed without any idea that a rearview mirror just might be in the middle of the windshield. The mirror blocks them from coming together and pushes both shades down so they are not in contact or close to the windshield, letting both light and heat in.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and compact when not in use
customer_reviews.text: This shade is exactly what I was after. The size guide in the product listing was accurate. The rectangular shape covers the entire windshield and folds to a compact shape when not in use. There are a couple of obstructions, a fuel level monitor in the lower corner and electronics sensors behind the rear view mirror, that prevent the shade laying neatly in place over the windshield. Overall not a big deal to me, but you may want to consider a round shape if you have similar things permanent stuck to your windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Didn't realize this was two pieces
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize until the package arrived that this was two separate pieces that each cover half of the windshield. That bothered me at first, but I've gotten used to it. It does make it a little more awkward to place it, but it also allows me to cover a side window depending on the angle of the sun. I really like how small and thin it folds, allowing easy storage between the seat and the arm rest, but the I also wonder if a thicker material would insulate better against the sun. Overall, I'm satisfied with the job it does.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sun/Heat protection
customer_reviews.text: I live in Phoenix Arizona, it gets 120 degrees in the summer. This shade is super effective at reducing the amount of heat from the sun. My testing with and without the shade yields about a 10 degree F reduction in heat for 3 hours of sun exposure. Product Recommendations: make something for the side windows and rear windows that is easy to use. This will help.
customer_reviews.author: Moebetta

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE - No longer fold up, permanently messed up.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE July 2020. Both shields failed. No longer fold up properly, have to force closure and resulting shield permanently bent. Sad, did not last all the long. Just be cautious,, compare how well the shields age. These did not for me. Had issue with original delivery of ezyshade. Very quick, generous customer service solved the problem. Very good sunshield, just used a week. Next test will be long term toughness. Will update. For now, recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BDG

customer_reviews.title: light, flexible, easy to use and stow.
customer_reviews.text: Simple product that works well. I like how it can fold up quickly and be stowed without taking up to much space. I've noticed a 10-15 degree difference on the inside of the car as my car sits and bakes in the Texas sun. When folding the screens away, you'll fold it into a circle and then need to wiggle it into the bag by altering the shape of the screens back and forth into an oblong shape to get it back into the bag. That's probably the only thing I would do to improve the user experience, getting the screens back into the bag easier. Other than that, 5 star review, shipped quickly, works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Zer0reZ

customer_reviews.title: Good shades; a little small
customer_reviews.text: Good quality sunshades--good looking, well built, folds up nicely, deflects a lot of heat. I ordered the size recommended in the chart in the product photos: size small for a Corolla. The size small is a little too small for the 2017 Corolla--they don't quite fill the windshield and we can barely get them to stay up by using the sun visors to hold them. By all means buy these; the quality is great. But double-check the size recommended on the chart.
customer_reviews.author: djd

customer_reviews.title: Does the job at a fraction of the price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a windshield shade for our camper and saw some cost three and four times more than these. I like that this shade is two parts, they overlap slightly and they look smooth and work great. I have a rear view mirror mounted to my windshield which wasn’t a problem the shades fit in front of the mirror and I put the sun visors down to help hold the shades in place.
customer_reviews.author: BB in VT

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t fit properly in my vehicle. I drive a crossover/compact suv and it doesn’t fit right in my windshield. Also very hard to fold up, the metal lining tends to get “stuck” and you have to unbend it. Honestly so frustrating. It also stays very wrinkly. I’d rather spend a little more and get something of better quality especially since I use it very often.
customer_reviews.author: Selena C.

customer_reviews.title: They work well but its a bit tricky to learn the "art" of folding them back up.
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty good. I wish they were slightly larger for my Camry's windshield by about 2 inches but they are perfect size for the Jetta. They pop open really easy so watch your face. Folding them back up took a little practice. In fact, three of us all trying to figure it out for about 10 minutes. Finally, we got it and now it's easy to do. I feel so accomplished. They do a good job of reflecting the sunlight and decreasing the temperature in the car and fold away into a little bag, assuming you can figure out how to fold them up :-) ). We keep it in the door pocket for quick access. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger88

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay in place in my Toyota Camry
customer_reviews.text: The sunshade will not stay in place because of the size of my 2013 Toyota Camry's rear view mirror. I have an XLE package and the rearview mirror may be larger because of the technology it encompasses. Nevertheless, the sunshade is too rigid and when it bumps the back of the mirror housing, it slides out of place and can't be propped up properly. May not be a problem for a different model/mirror.
customer_reviews.author: CAL in Roanoke, VA

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is Off
customer_reviews.text: Hey guys, giving you honest feedback here. The size I chose m, medium said it would cover my small suv (Nissan Rogue). It’s not quite doing the trick and in SoCal this time of year it’s consistently 100°+. The fit is awkward too, can’t seem to find the right one. Seems like you have the sun/heat blocking technology, but a lot still gets through my windshield. Would I benefit from a large one? If so, is there a way to trade in? Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: KAPtureDM

customer_reviews.title: This is the type of material (nylon) I like in a shade
customer_reviews.text: This is the type of material (nylon) I like in a shade. Much better than those crinkly mylar shades. Easy to fold. The dual shades are much easier to handle that the ones that cover entire windshield with a single shade. This dual shade can overlap itself in the center area to accommodate various windshield widths. Size is 28"x31" which seems to be standard for auto shades. I only wish someone would make a nylon shade a couple inches longer. This one is great for my CRV but a bit short for my van.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sunshade
customer_reviews.text: I like that it comes in two pieces not one. You have to move it around a couple of times to get it to fit. Even then it is not a complete fit because of the rear view mirror. But it is better than most. It is easy to put away and light. It does keep the car somewhat cool - your steering wheel and seats are not burning hot if you are parked in direct sunlight. In all, if you want a sunshade that is maneuverable, easy to store and can keep your car from boiling hot when parked in the sun, I say try this.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Work as Promised. Keep the Sun OUT!
customer_reviews.text: The Ezy Shade is a very cool product that keep the sun out of your car. It has a very flexible frame that makes it easy to use. I bought one for each of our cars, a 2005 MDX, 2008 honda and a 2003 volvo. The overlapping shades make it easy to cover the entire windshield . I have been using the sun visor to make sure they stay up but I dont think I need them, its just my precaution since I really dont like a hot steering wheel or hot seat. The difference in the car on a hot sunny day since I have been using the Ezy shade is dramatic.
customer_reviews.author: Doug L

customer_reviews.title: IT DOESN'T FIT but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my Altima and followed the image with the car models. It did not fit at all, I agree with some of the other people who said that same, I should've listened. Already opened it I'm sure I can't refund it, these looked like they could've worked... Update: their customer service is great, they fixed my issue by sending me a replacement. They really make sure their customers are satisfied with their purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Best i had
customer_reviews.text: I live in Vegas so i deal with real heat and the power of sun can be ruthless in summer with 100 and 110+ Fahrenheit. I have used different kind of shades and this are the ones who can resist the sun more than 1 year, besides doing a great job at blocking the harmful sun rays. Other brands have to be discarded every year. I like this product that much that i have purchased 3 in 12 months, including some for a very dear friend.
customer_reviews.author: dispa3

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but kind of hard to fold
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of keeping the sun off of the dashboard and steering wheel while I'm at work. I got the suggested size for my car (medium) and I'd say they're a little big, but that's not really a problem. The only issue I've had is that it takes me quite a while to fold these things down. I don't know if I'm doing it wrong or if there's just some trick I haven't figured out yet, but I'm sure I'll get better at it. This also isn't a major issue though as I can just stuff them in my back seat.
customer_reviews.author: R W

customer_reviews.title: Sweet, they GAVE me a FREE second set!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure that I was aware that it came with a nano pad. Not sure if that's supposed to be for the easy shades or not but I love Nano pads so that was really cool. So far the shades look great, I use them in my Jeep Commander, we will see how they work over time. This package came with a code that got me another brand new set for free! 100% worth your money!
customer_reviews.author: Æ

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions!!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was fighting getting this THING back to a small circle to strap and store away each time and finally just threw it in the back seat frustrated as hell. Went back and fully read and watched a video on how to fold back up....the secret is to twist your hands in opposite directions while folding it up and now I can nail it every time!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Very lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Needs one corner on each shade cut out to allow room around my Audi rear view mirror. I’ve had a similar one for 15 yrs. finally found this to replace my old one. I luv em. Also please only ship UPS. This pkg sat in USPS for 2.5 days. Arrived there Wed 4am. Was delivered Fri 2pm. Sad. PO is 2mi up the road & I couldn’t get pkg for 2.5 days.
customer_reviews.author: jz

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mazda CX9. So far, it seems to keep the sun out completely. I did have a bit of trouble folding it the first few uses, so i just placed it unfolded in the very back until I could practice. It's a bit cumbersome trying to fold it in the front seat since space is limited. It also large enough to use in my husband's Toyota Tundra. It's the perfect size for his Tundra since there is more room in the front seats.
customer_reviews.author: 5starchick

customer_reviews.title: It is very light and you can store it anywhere easily (I slip it between the armrest and the seatbelt ...
customer_reviews.text: The sunshades fit my Pontiac Grand Prix extremely well. I have had A Lot of sunshades (I currently have 4) but this shade covers the windshield more completely, folds up smaller and quicker, and blocks more heat than any shade I have owned. It is very light and you can store it anywhere easily (I slip it between the armrest and the seatbelt latch and you never know it's there till you need it. I would like to throw my others out and replace them with this shade but It seems like a waste of money. I'll hope they wear out soon and then I'll replace them with the Ezyshade.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

product_meta.title: EzyShade Windshield Sun Shade + Extra Item. See Size-Chart with Your Vehicle (Easy-Read). Foldable 2-Piece Car Sunshades Reflect and Protect Your Vehicle from UV Sun and Heat. Standard (Medium) Size
feature_bullets: BEST COVERAGE. BEST FIT. Find your vehicle in the easy-to-read SIZE CHART. Don't persist with shades that don't quite fit right. EzyShade Sunshades are 2 identical rectangular shades. This allows for maximum adaptability to your car’s windshield. You can install vertically or horizontally to achieve the perfect fit. The overlap of the 2 shades ensures a better fit with superior UV block-out (over 99%) and unrivalled heat reduction (over 82%).

EASY TO USE AND FOLD. EzyShade’s unique design gives you two folding options, one of which is so simple that EzyShade even guarantee it! There's no wrestling with these sunshades. EzyShade is quick and easy to install, and quick and easy to fold and store away. Check out the folding video on this product page.

KEEP COOL. Don't let the hot sun damage your car or your mood. The superior double shade design offers maximum coverage and efficient UV and sun protection (over 99% block out!), keeping you and your loved ones’ cooler and happier when you step back into your car.

LOOK GOOD. Because EzyShade delivers such great fitting sunshades, you will immediately see a striking difference in appearance. It’s just a nice little bonus to have sunshades that look right as well as fit right.

BONUS PRODUCT. Every sunshade purchased includes a bonus non-slip sticky dashboard mat! This convenient little mat lets you slap your cell phone, change and other small items against your dash, maintaining a secure grip.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars8,401 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
